data.title: Adopt Typescript 2.0
data.body:
- [x] adopt TS 2.0 in the VS Code code base
- [x] bundle TS 2.0 with VS Code
- [x] Enable the use of TS 2.0 for extension development. 
- [x] Check that the vscode yeoman generator is up to date with TS 2.0

data.title: Support preserving cursor location when reformatting a document
data.body:
Currently when you reformat a document the cursor remains at the same line/character. If there are significant changes above your cursor then this is quite confusing.

It would be great if `DocumentFormattingEditProvider.provideDocumentFormattingEdits` was supplied the current cursor location and able to return the new position after reformatting.

data.title: Explorer context menu for file under folder and file under Open Editors should have similar grouping
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a folder in vscode and open one of the files under the folder in the editor
2. Right click on this opened file from the Open Editors section
   ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16890566/17412491/db3abf48-5a31-11e6-9752-37603bb6ac06.png)
3. Right click on the same file in the Explorer viewlet under the folder.
4. Compare the 2 and observe that menu item grouping is different

`Open to the Side`, `Reveal in Explorer` and `Open in Command Prompt` should be under the same group

data.title: Cannot copy exception messages (event short text) into clipboard
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: OS El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a .NET console app
2. Add the code to throw an exception
3. In the debugging section try to copy the exception message / stacktrace (Copy Value)
4. You get the message "error CS1012: Too many characters in character literal"

data.title: Undo/Redo not working in search bar.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1 (1.3.1)
- OS Version: OS X El Capitan (10.11.4)

Steps to Reproduce:
- In any opened file, press Cmd + f.
- Type something.
- Cmd + z to undo what you typed last in the search bar.
- "Undo" action applied on the opened file instead of search input field.

When in focus, undo-redo should work in search bar, as copy-paste do.

data.title: Markdown code block with type and extra space breaks rest of document
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insiders
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:

Create markdown file with content:

(Notice extra space after closing ``` in first and last case)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1723815/17402710/90dc619a-5a22-11e6-8e5f-7cbb6541662f.png)

Github handles it fine:

```
let test = 0
```

Coloring ok here (closing code block has space)

``` ts
let test = 0
```

Coloring ok here (closing code block has NO space)

``` ts
let test = 0
```

Coloring ok here (closing code block has space)

data.title: Terminate Running Task and Retry
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

When I try to run a task and there's already one running, I get the warning 

> There is an active running task right now. Terminate it first before executing another task.

with the button `Terminate Running Task`.

I suggest that this button could not only terminate the running task but also launch the one I asked for.
Something like `Terminate Running Task and Retry`.

data.title: Backspace dedents instead of deleting character

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Win 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Enable indentation using spaces
2. Press tab to insert indentation
3. Hit backspace

Actual result:
An number of spaces equivalent to your indentation size gets deleted

Expected result:
One space gets deleted

We already have shortcuts for deleting entire lines and dedenting by a single unit of indentation. Magic behavior that hijacks the backspace key is one of the reasons I switched over from Atom. Currently there is no key for simply deleting one space, and I believe backspace is a sensible default for this (this is also how Visual Studio behaves by default).

data.title: After working for some time (perhaps dragging tabs?) I cannot use Escape to hide find widget
data.body: I will keep an eye out for clear repro steps, but it just happened to me the second time.

data.title: Allow for floating windows

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi,
I suggest floating windows option for:
- Terminal
- Debug console
- Problems
- Output

Eventually:
- tabs
- Explorer / search / debug / git / extensions 

This way we could take advantage of large screen space and / or multi monitors.

Having to constantly switch between the various windows is not optimum working flow.

data.title: Wrong formatting node js file
Feature requests: CTRL+click to follow non-import links
Stop extension watch task when stopping extension run

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Version 1.4.0-insider
- start vscode fresh
- open a extension sample code, e.g. https://github.com/DanTup/Dart-Code/
- in the settings unfilter the out folder, so it can be seen in the exlorer
- delete the out/src folder, create a empty src folder again
- press F5.
- Extension Development Host starts, open a dart file, all works fine, files are compiled
- shutdown the Extension Development Host
- delete the out/src folder, create a empty src folder again
- press F5.
- Extension Development Host starts, open a dart file, error, out/src stays empty.
- Run 'terminate running task'
- press F5.
- Extension Development Host starts, open a dart file, all works fine, files are compiled

Wouldn't it be better to kill the task when the Extension Development Host is closed? It is not obvious to the user that there's still a task running and how to terminate it. Also I don't need to have my files compiled until I start the the Extension Development Host again.

data.title: Problem with Powershell-Syntax - after legal statement all lines seems to be interpret as string
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  
  Version 1.3.1  
  Commit e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae  
  Datum 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z

  Renderer 49.0.2623.75  
  Node 5.10.0  
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Copy this Code in VSCode  

```
DoSomething | ft Sucess, @{Label="X-Powered-By"; Expression={$_.Headers.'X-Powered-By'}} -AutoSize
Write-Host "Hello World"
```
1. The line `Write-Host "Hello World"` is interpret as string
   ![vscode-problem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6566207/17397503/99890940-5a38-11e6-843c-eb9eae227c71.png)

data.title: Regex not working on ungreedy captures
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Imagine you have a line such as `if (ConfigurationManager.AppSettings["Bar"] != null && bool.Parse(ConfigurationManager.AppSettings["Foo"]))`
2. You want to find and replace the ConfigurationManager with a object and property
3. We can search like so `(ConfigurationManager\.AppSettings\[")(.+?)("\])`, this searches finds and sets capture groups.
4. Notice the `?` in the bit where we are searching inside the square brackets. This says search for anything inside square brackets but be ungreedy and then find a closing bracket. Without this `?` it would find the last occurrence of the square bracket on the line.
5. VSCode seems to use the `?` to only find the first occurrence of a match on one line and ignores the second existence of `ConfigurationManager.AppSettings["Foo"]` 
6. When we replace with `this.myobject.$2` obviously only the first occurrence is replaced
7. Sublime Text works with this regex to find and replace

data.title: "The window is no longer responding" after webpack build
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

I can run "webpack index.js" in the command prompt and it works fine.

Recently, if I build in VS Code, after the build completes it crashes and says the window is no longer responding. Any idea what could be causing this?

I just downloaded the VS Code insiders build and the problem isn't on there so I guess I'll just use that. I suppose this is fixed already but not included in the stable 1.3.1 release?

data.title: Yaml syntax highlight break for comma in quoted string
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a yaml file and add following code 

``` yaml
     fields: publisher_id.`split(., 1, 1)`
```
1. The highlight breaks at comma in vscode

And I also created a PR which is abandoned by me [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/10105), and it breaks some cases about comma, I am not quite sure if it's right, so could you please fix the issue. And in other editors like sublime and atom the colorizer result are all correct
